replies.body: Hi Burin, Thanks for finding the bugs and I am sorry for responding so late. 1. This was an easy fix and you can get a working version of the zone shades component (one that writes the diffuse transmittance) by syncing with the github. 2. I am not able to replicate the problem on my machine.  I get vertical blinds on my zones when I set the horOrVertical to False: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/ec4fSw8DDIx9Q0Ig7mCnjXpU*5OHVKHVJevmOVTkQ2NKk79KAmlFKrtZc1q-wckc0mC*OirhkXvL7CQxNtpSWCkjo0lAG7WG/VerticalBlinds.PNG) Can you upload you GH file and I can see what is wrong with your specific case? -Chris

Hi Chris -

I appreciate your looking into this.  The GH file is attached.

Burin, Thanks for posting the file.  I was able to fix the bug.  It seems that it resulted from some code that Mostapha put in the North angle function, which I will admit I do not fully understand but it seemed unnecessary so I took it out. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/E-eiwesnIS0AkqBwrY-bzcFkL3hYfmXiIM*Pj0SDB3uOUxzaAhvm7qyQqJDLkINCrQn3vuNHPbtn-za8tgpxbCPfnxEsBaM-/NorthIsValid.PNG) You can find the fixed component on the github and in the attached file. -Chris
